Department of State Washington, Dec. 5, 1888.
Emory H. Taunt, Esqre. Commercial Agent of the United States at Boma, Congo Free State (Now at 1532 J st, N.W, Washington, D.C.)
Sir,
In addition to the instructions heretofore given you in regard to pro- ceeding to your post, it is proper for me to state that under the act making appropriations for the diplomate and consular service of the United States for the fiscal year ending June 30, 1889, approved July 18,1888, th provision for
a
<pb facs="20170614_141421"
a commercial agent at Boma is coupled with "authority to visit and report upon "the commercial resources od the upper "and lower Congo basin, their products "their minerals, their vegetable wealth, "the openings for American trade, and "to collect such information on the sub "ject of the country as shall be of "interest to the United States".
The Department is not in a position, even if it were thought advisable, to give you any definite instructions as to the extent of your travels in that region, or as to the special subjects upon which you should report. The general direction in which Congress desires
that
<pb facs="20170614_141430"
that inquires should be made is sufficently indicated in the quotation from the act given above. You will hear this authority in mind, and use your best judgement and discretion in visiting the various parts of the Congo basin, and in reporting upon the subjects which maybe of interest to the people of this country.
I am, Sir, Your obident servant G.L.Rives Assistant Secretary
